explanation: The report is not supported by the evidence. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 recommends using const for pointer targets that are never modified, but you must show that the pointed-to objects are in fact immutable in the API and all call sites. In the shown code: 1) metal_linux_dev_dma_map simply forwards its bus and device pointers to other APIs (to_linux_bus/to_linux_device and ldrv->dev_dma_map) that are declared to take non-const pointers; there is no proof those callees do not modify the objects. 2) The helper container_of/to_linux_* functions and the dev_dma_map callback signatures expect non-const pointers, so changing the parameters to const would be an API break unless all related prototypes are adjusted. 3) Fields like irq_info and bus might be written elsewhere in the codebase (no evidence they are read-only). Therefore the claim that these pointers “should” be const (and that the code thus violates 8.13) is speculative. To legitimately flag a MISRA 8.13 violation you must demonstrate that a pointer target is never modified anywhere and can be made const without breaking the API; that proof is absent here. Conclusion: the reported violation is incorrect.
